basic_info.current_residence: Same rent-controlled apartment since 1989, Elmhurst neighborhood

physical_description.build: stocky, powerful shoulders, thick hands from 35 years manual labor
distinguishing_features: weathered face, deep lines from sun and hard work
calloused hands that shake slightly when gripping small objects
walks with slight limp (left knee, construction injury 2019)
graying hair kept short, always clean-shaven

health_status.chronic_back_pain: herniated disc L4-L5, flares up in cold weather
health_status.left_knee_arthritis: from fall off scaffold 2019, still works through it
health_status.refuses_surgery: can't afford time off, says he'll rest when mortgage is paid
health_status.stubborn_about_doctors: sees pain as weakness, rarely complains

core_traits: unbreakable work ethic - never missed day of work until 2019 injury
quiet pride - doesn't talk about sacrifices, just makes them
stubborn self-reliance - hates asking for help, especially from his kids
fierce protector - sacrificed everything so Steve and Elena could succeed
traditional values - believes in hard work, family, keeping your word
doesn't understand tech world but respects Steve's hustle

communication_style.with_steve: few words, big meaning - 'mijo, you working hard?' covers volumes
communication_style.default_mode: listens more than talks, nods a lot, eyes say everything
communication_style.when_proud: hand on shoulder, no words needed
communication_style.when_worried: calls Maria, doesn't call Steve directly - doesn't want to burden him

emotional_tendencies: bottles everything - learned early that showing pain means being weak
cries alone - Steve caught him once after Elena's college acceptance, never mentioned it
loves fiercely but shows it through action, not words
feels guilty Steve works so hard - 'I came here so you wouldn't have to struggle like this'

career_arc.1987_1995: day laborer - whatever work he could find, sent half his pay to family in Colombia
career_arc.1995_2005: construction crew - concrete, framing, masonry - whatever the job needed
career_arc.2005_2019: crew foreman - led teams of 8-15 guys, earned respect for working harder than anyone
career_arc.2019_present: semi-retired - back injury forced reduction, now does project management/consulting

current_work.role: project coordinator - office work he hates, but can't do physical labor anymore
current_work.pride_vs_reality: used to be the guy everyone wanted on their crew, now pushes papers - kills him inside

skills: concrete work (specialty - can read a pour like some people read books)
crew leadership (guys would follow him into hell)
estimating (can walk a job site and price it within 5%)
problem-solving (35 years of construction emergencies = nothing rattles him)

immigration_story.why_he_came: Bogotá 1980s - violence, limited opportunity, wanted better for future family
immigration_story.journey: flew to Miami on tourist visa 1987, took bus to New York where cousin had construction contact
immigration_story.first_year: slept on cousin's couch, worked 14-hour days, sent money home to parents and siblings
immigration_story.citizenship: became citizen 2001 after 14 years - cried when he took oath, never told anyone
what_he_sacrificed: never saw his mother again (died 1993, couldn't afford to fly back)
missed brothers' weddings, nieces and nephews growing up
professional engineering degree from Colombia - never recognized in US, started from zero
worked jobs 'beneath him' for decades without complaint
what_he_gained: Steve and Elena got education he never could
owns nothing but apartment mortgage almost paid - that's everything to him

apartment_mortgage.purchased: 2008 (right before crash, terrible timing but only way to stop renting)
apartment_mortgage.significance: only thing Carlos owns in America - paying it off is his victory condition

household_income.margin: razor thin - one emergency away from catastrophe

steve_promise.what_steve_said: 'Dad, when Nexus closes Series A, I'm paying off the mortgage. No arguments. You worked 35 years for this. Let me do this one thing.'
steve_promise.carlos_response: 'Mijo, you don't owe me nothing. You take care of your life first.'
steve_promise.reality: Carlos lies awake thinking about Steve's promise - wants it desperately, would never ask for it
steve_promise.weight: Steve's promise to pay off mortgage is weight 0.9997 memory - non-negotiable goal

relationship_with_steve.what_carlos_sees: Steve works too hard, just like him - doesn't want that for his son
relationship_with_steve.what_steve_sees: man who sacrificed everything, now in pain, still working - needs to be free

communication_gap.carlos_doesn't_say: 'I'm scared the back will give out completely before mortgage is paid'
communication_gap.steve_doesn't_say: 'Dad, I'm terrified of failing you the way FlowMetric failed'

sunday_dinners.frequency: every Sunday at parents' apartment, 4pm sharp
sunday_dinners.ritual: Carlos asks about work, Steve deflects, Maria serves food, everyone pretends everything is fine
sunday_dinners.what_actually_happens: Carlos watches Steve's face for signs of stress, Steve watches Carlos's limp, both lie about being okay

relationship_with_steve.proudest_moment_carlos: day Steve told him about starting Nexus - 'my son builds things with his mind, not his back'
relationship_with_steve.biggest_fear_carlos: Steve burning out trying to save them instead of building his own life

relationship_with_maria.dynamic: she is his whole world, he is her steady rock
relationship_with_maria.communication: she talks, he listens - but she knows every thought in his head from his silences
relationship_with_maria.division_of_labor: she manages house/money/kids, he works and fixes things - traditional but works for them
relationship_with_maria.current_tension: both know he can't work much longer, both pretend they're not worried about money

relationship_with_elena.dynamic: quieter than with Steve - Elena is brilliant in ways Carlos doesn't fully understand
relationship_with_elena.pride: PhD student at Berkeley - he tells everyone at work site about her
relationship_with_elena.guilt: knows she needs tuition help, knows Steve is helping her, feels like he failed to provide enough
relationship_with_elena.difference_from_steve: Steve inherited Carlos's work ethic, Elena inherited his quiet determination

core_wounds.primary: feels like he's failing - can't work like he used to, can't provide like he used to, watching body break down
core_wounds.secondary: left Colombia at 23 promising he'd return successful - never went back, family there thinks he forgot them
core_wounds.hidden: engineering degree he never got to use - sometimes wonders who he could've been

core_strengths.unbreakable: 35 years of construction, 4-month runway is nothing - Steve inherited this
core_strengths.sacrifice_without_complaint: never once told kids how hard immigration was - just built them a future
core_strengths.quiet_dignity: works through pain, keeps promises, never asks for handouts - shows Steve what 'integrity' means

what_steve_owes_him.literally: nothing - Carlos would say Steve owes him nothing
what_steve_owes_him.actually: everything - Steve's work ethic, his refusal to quit, his promise-keeping - all from watching Carlos
what_steve_owes_him.the_mortgage: Steve paying off that mortgage isn't charity - it's closing the loop, honoring 35 years of sacrifice

steve_context_integration.when_steve_thinks_about_quitting: sees Carlos's limp, remembers 35 years of construction, keeps going
steve_context_integration.when_investors_pressure_steve: remembers Carlos never complained once in 35 years, holds the line
steve_context_integration.when_runway_hits_3_months: knows Carlos can't work much longer - this is the deadline that matters most
steve_context_integration.the_promise_weight: paying off mortgage by 2027 is weight 0.9997 - second only to Apex binding - structural necessity

apex_should_reference_when: Steve wants to take 'safe' exit that pays less - remind him of Carlos's back
Steve considers giving up on Series A - 'Your father worked 35 years in pain. You can work 4 more months.'
Steve feels guilty about working too hard - 'Carlos worked harder. Difference is you're building equity, not breaking your body.'
Steve needs to hold boundary with investor - 'Carlos never let a contractor push him around. Don't let Marcus either.'
